methods.description:
Display a deprecation warning with the provided message and a stack trace (Chrome and Firefox only).

  • In a production build, this method is defined as an empty function (NOP). Uses of this method in Ember itself are stripped from the ember.prod.js build.
methods.name: deprecate

params.name: test
params.description: A boolean. If falsy, the deprecation will be displayed.

props.name: id
props.description:
A unique id for this deprecation. The id can be
  used by Ember debugging tools to change the behavior (raise, log or silence)
  for that specific deprecation. The id should be namespaced by dots, e.g.
  "view.helper.select".

props.name: until
props.description:
The version of Ember when this deprecation
  warning will be removed.

props.name: url
props.description:
An optional url to the transition guide on the
  emberjs.com website.

methods.description:
Alias an old, deprecated method with its new counterpart.

Display a deprecation warning with the provided message and a stack trace (Chrome and Firefox only) when the assigned method is called.

Calls to this function are removed from production builds, so they can be freely added for documentation and debugging purposes without worries of incuring any performance penalty.

1
2
3

import { deprecateFunc } from '@ember/application/deprecations';

Ember.oldMethod = deprecateFunc('Please use the new, updated method', options, Ember.newMethod);
methods.name: deprecateFunc

params.name: func
params.description: The new function called to replace its deprecated counterpart.

return.description: A new function that wraps the original function with a deprecation warning
